ygData.subject: Re: New
ygData.msgSnippet: ... be into ... level ... attending ... have fun. ... to play, ... people.  Make ... as ... the ... Ask questions yes, but please dont be a beggar or an
ygData.messageBody:
--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "Techpriest" <techpriest@o...>
wrote:
> The addiction for him may not be the addiction for you. He might
be into
> mastering all trade skills, getting the best equipment, hitting max
level
> with as many different characters as he can or he might like
attending
> parties, picnics and other social events. Find your own niche and
have fun.
> There are over 400,000 monthly subscribers. No matter how you like
to play,
> there are bound to be some other people just like that.
>
> The only wrong way to play EQ is to play just to pester other
people. Make
> friends and feel free to ask questions.
>
> ---
> Lato, Paladin of Karana, Halfling of the 22nd season
> Member of the Clan of Brothers
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: danielleheier [mailto:danielleheier@y...]
> > Sent: Saturday, August 28, 2004 6:46 PM
> > To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [EverQuest] New
> >
> >
> > Hi,
> >
> > I'm Danielle and I'm quite new with EverQuest. It is my husband
> > indeed who kind of made me interested in the game on the internet
as
> > he is very good at it and can play hours (when I say hours I mean
> > LOTS of hours!!!) in a row!! I saw him playing a straight 24 hours
> > recently.... :) So hopefully this group will help me understand
the
> > addiction it does create!! :)
> >
> > Thank you!!
> >
> > Danielle
> >

Ask questions yes, but please dont be a beggar or an annoyance. The
fastest way to be cast out in EQ, at least on the soocial standard is
to be a beggar.....

I am sure we all dislike the beggars....
